newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan textiles seek Indian cotton import.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan textiles seek Indian cotton import.

text.p: Pakistani textile mills urged the government on Monday to allow them to import cotton from neighbouring India to help cut output costs and boost textile exports.
"We want to buy Indian cotton at international rates but need government's permission, All Pakistan Textile Mills Association (APTMA) chairman Javed Saifullah Khan told a news conference.
He said Pakistan's own cotton production from the 1996/97 crop, now estimated at 8.7 million bales (375 lbs each), was not enough and not of qood quality this time.
Textile mills would save on freight as India could supply cotton on trucks at the border, he said.
Pakistan allows import of 587 items from India, including sugar and cement, and Khan said cotton should be added to list.
Higher rates of domestic cotton, electricity, labour and taxes would not allow a revival of textile industry, which is now facing a shortage of funds, he said. --Karachi Newsroom 9221-5685192
